channel.title: Guid Ban?
channel.description:
I would like to know, how to setup a guid ban command? I mean, not the command but just making the server having a guid ban option? Because, Ban, may be easily avoided by just switching account, IPBan ... can be avoided, just a bit harder but still really easy ... Guid Ban mixed with IPBan and Ban ... you will rarely come back in the server after.. So yeah I would like to know, how to code a guid ban option ..?
Please help me (:

item.title: Guid Ban?
item.dc:creator: @shadowtoon shadowtoon
item.description:
@shadowtoon wrote:

Just, how to add it in the codes?

Read full topic

item.title: Guid Ban?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

shadowtoon:

maybe can get faked, all bans can be faked or so, but all ban mixed into an user, will definitly make it more difficult for him to get back on.

No. All you would have to do is randomize values. Really not that difficult to do. In order to stop them, you’d literally have to block everything, which is pointless. The most you can do is block the host name pattern.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @shadowtoon shadowtoon

maybe can get faked, all bans can be faked or so, but all ban mixed into an user, will definitly make it more difficult for him to get back on.

item.title: Guid Ban?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

shadowtoon:

Tbh, I dont really know how Guid Ban works. I just know, it used to ban computers, what in computers? I don’t exactly know and the owner… Is always to busy and didnt see him online on skype for AGES.

If you’re talking about the host name, that can be faked. If you’re talking about the MAC address(ie. the address associated with a specific network card) that can also be faked.

Read full topic

item.title: Guid Ban?
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

Do you mean the FQDN?

en.wikipedia.org

Fully qualified domain name

A fully qualified domain name (FQDN), sometimes also referred to as an absolute domain name, is a domain name that specifies its exact location in the tree hierarchy of the Domain Name System (DNS). It specifies all domain levels, including at least a second-level domain and a top-level domain. A fully qualified domain name is distinguished by its lack of ambiguity: it can be interpreted only in one way. The DNS root domain is unnamed which is expressed by having an empty label in the DNS hierarc...

If so it is possible.

Read full topic

It’s possible, I used to be a moderator in an old popular server which had Guid Ban, and much other stuff… but I have to admit it, the owner of 14 years old had a really great knownledge of java language
